title: 110_s1891
content: IMMUNITY FOR REPORTS OF SUSPECTED TERRORIST ACTIVITY OR SUSPICIOUS BEHAVIOR AND RESPONSE. Immunity is granted to individuals who report suspected terrorist activity or suspicious behavior in good faith and based on reasonable suspicion. They are protected from civil liability under any law for making such reports, unless the report is knowingly false or made with reckless disregard for the truth. Authorized officials who respond to covered activity with reasonable and good faith actions also have qualified immunity from civil liability. Authorized officials who observe or receive reports of covered activity and respond in good faith shall have qualified immunity from civil liability. Those not entitled to qualified immunity will still be immune from civil liability if they take reasonable action in response to reported activity. This immunity does not affect the officials' ability to act. In response to reported activity, authorized officials acting in good faith are granted qualified immunity from civil liability. This immunity does not affect their ability to assert any defense, privilege, or immunity available to them. Any person or authorized official found immune from liability is entitled to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees from the plaintiff. The term "authorized official" includes employees or agents of passenger transportation systems responsible for security. The term "authorized official" includes employees or agents of passenger transportation systems responsible for security. Covered activity refers to any suspicious transaction or occurrence involving a passenger transportation system indicating potential threat. Any suspicious transaction, activity, or occurrence involving a passenger transportation system or vehicle that may indicate a threat to passenger safety, security, or terrorism. Passenger transportation includes public transportation, over-the-road bus transportation, school bus transportation, and intercity passenger rail transportation. The term "passenger transportation system" includes public transportation, over-the-road bus transportation, school bus transportation, intercity passenger rail transportation, passenger vessel transportation, waterborne transportation service, and air transportation of passengers. The term "passenger transportation system" encompasses entities providing passenger transportation using vehicles, including infrastructure. This section on air transportation of passengers takes effect immediately upon enactment and applies to activities and claims thereafter.
